name: The Chinstrap Division
declaringWar: You are standing in the way of my operation! Get 'em boys!
attacked: I'll make you regret for ever picking a fight with the wrong penguin!
introduction: General Skipper of the Chinstrap Division here, can you move out of my way?
tradeRequest: It appears that you do have a reason for existing â€“ to make this deal with me.
uniques: [+20]% Strength <when fighting in [Tundra] tiles>
"Borrows" city names from other civilizations in the game
[+15]% Production when constructing [Gunpowder] units [in all cities]
Units ignore terrain costs when moving into any tile with Tundra

name: The Adelie Armored Division
declaringWar: Your destructive behavior will not be tolerated, you must be stopped! Onward to war, comrades!
attacked: Well well, getting a little cocky now are we?
defeated: Sigh... Guess this is how we'll go down in history.
introduction: This is Commander Kowalski speaking, are you a part of the Division or not?
tradeRequest: Let us commence a trade agreement.
uniques: [+20]% Strength <when fighting in [Tundra] tiles>
"Borrows" city names from other civilizations in the game
[+15]% Production when constructing [Armored] units [in all cities]
[+2] Movement <for [Armored] units>

name: The Emperor's Navy
declaringWar: The Emperor will see to your destruction.
attacked: You dare challenge His Greatness and his imperial fleet?
introduction: I bid you welcome. I speak on behalf of His Greatness and the Empire.
hateHello: This is restricted only to loyal subjects... And you're not one of them.
tradeRequest: Would you like some Ice cubes?
uniques: Units ignore terrain costs when moving into any tile with Ocean
"Borrows" city names from other civilizations in the game
[+20]% Production when constructing [Water] units [in all cities]
Gain [5] [Production] <upon entering a new era>
Gain [1] [Production] <upon building a [Arctic Coast] improvement>
Double movement in [terrainFilter]

name: Svalbard
attacked: Bears see tricks and deceit as plain as arms and legs. We can see in a way humans have forgotten. You cannot trick a bear.
introduction: I will serve you in your campaign until you have a victory.
uniques: [+2 Production] from every [Snow]
[+1 Food] from every [Coast]
[+1 Food] from every [Ocean]
[+1] Movement <in [Snow] tiles>
"Borrows" city names from other civilizations in the game

name: The Kairuku Savages
declaringWar: Today, we feast on your blood!
attacked: You have mistaken us as simple fools. Sound the war drums!
defeated: Perhaps... They were right about us being savages...
introduction: Welcome to my tribe, stranger. I am Chief Duke, would you like some bear meat?
hateHello: Step any closer, and I will throw a spear at your heart.
tradeRequest: I heard you have very luxurious items. May we see it?
uniques: [+1] Movement <for [Sword] units>
"Borrows" city names from other civilizations in the game
When conquering an encampment, earn [15] Gold and recruit a Barbarian unit <with [67]% chance>
[-10]% maintenance costs <for [Land] units>

name: The Humboldt Sailors
declaringWar: Alas, yer treasury is something I couldn't resist! Hands on deck!
attacked: Ye raid me, I raid you!
introduction: I be this Captain of the Humboldt Sailors. Step aside if ye don't wanta be raided!
tradeRequest: Yarr, let's do some bartering, ay?
uniques: Receive triple Gold from Barbarian encampments and pillaging Cities
"Borrows" city names from other civilizations in the game
[Land] units gain the [Amphibious] promotion
[-10]% maintenance costs <for [Water] units>
[+20]% Production when constructing [Water] units [in all cities]
